title: Grades 6-8: Classical Languages, Level III, Novice Mid to Advanced Low Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

6E3EAB6C68AE4497AF68EBE8593CC8FF.description: read prose or poetry aloud with attention to features of declamation such as metrical structure, meaningful phrase grouping, and appropriate voice inflection.

1C486CA7F4D94B2B93A2C828403B995D.description: cite the justification for an opinion or preference orally or in writing using textual evidence; and

34B0D09DD36440F09B42009D5FC1A562.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally or in writing using a mixture of phrases and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

F99C0487ABBD4CDB82E61444A49E5A26.description: compare and contrast cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials.

25A54B1CFBE242ECBD68E93017B6CE53.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in contextualized texts, audio, or audiovisual materials; and

01938F23AA614FCCA0BF898970709F20.description: analyze authentic literature with respect to stylistic topics such as elements of genre, literary devices, audience, or metrics;

F79E1F5DE5E44406932E256F05E5A3A4.description: paraphrase the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction or nonfiction texts or audio or audiovisual materials;

7B9B8DFDECF5484AAE3CCCF0774497D8.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials in a variety of contexts;

5E830BBFC00E46829B9C64F739135148.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends connected statements from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

A9A381D186B54AC2B92DDC0CB8B3C5FD.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken or written conversation using appropriate constructions such as the imperative mood, impersonal verbs, or the subjunctive mood.

A33277846B0B4724B5EB781B4BD91928.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken or written conversation using simple constructions such as impersonal verbs; and

B9778A2457DD47B9BE6D81F1999079B9.description: ask and respond to questions with simple elaboration in spoken or written conversation;

9ED8FE51ACA64922A0B14692BECA6C83.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

E804854202E5456E9F4F8BF484B27D66.description: Classical Languages, Level III, Novice Mid to Advanced Low Proficiency
